meanings.definition: The ability to withstand wear, pressure, or damage.
meanings.sent1: The durableness of the new phone case impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The durableness of the ancient castle walls amazed historians.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape had such durableness that it never tore, even in the fiercest battles.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship was a pillar of durableness in my life, always there to support me.
meanings.sent5: The durableness of the steel beams ensured the bridge's safety for decades.

meanings.definition: The quality of being long-lasting or enduring.
meanings.sent1: The durableness of the memories from that vacation still brings me joy.
meanings.sent2: The durableness of the antique clock made it a valuable family heirloom.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the durableness of his bad haircut, saying it seemed to last forever.
meanings.sent4: The durableness of their love story inspired many romantic novels.
meanings.sent5: The durableness of the mountain range stood as a testament to the power of nature.
